thread.title: Yoga studio burglary averted in Rutherford - Crime and Courts
thread.title_full: Yoga studio burglary averted in Rutherford - Crime and Courts - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Yoga studio burglary averted in Rutherford - Crime and Courts
text:
RUTHERFORD — A 64-year-old homeless man was arrested Tuesday as he tried to burglarize a yoga studio on Park Avenue, authorities said.
Steven D. Searcy, whose last known address was in Valhalla, N.Y., was charged with criminal mischief and possession of burglary tools, Capt. Patrick A. Feliciano said. He was held at the Bergen County Jail on $50,000 bail.
Feliciano said the manager of Fire Shaper Yoga Studio called police at 2:40 a.m. Tuesday to report that he was watching a live video feed from a studio security camera and saw an unknown man go in.
Police rushed to the studio, heard a noise and started searching inside, Feliciano said.
Sgt. Craig Capoano found Searcy hiding in a closet. He and Officer Katherine Calienni arrested the suspect, and other officers searched the business and found a stack of stolen money and burglar tools, Feliciano said.
Police also found an open safe with pry marks on it, Feliciano said.
— Jim Norman
